title: Leveraging Data Mining Algorithms to Recommend Source Code Changes. (arXiv:2305.00323v1 [cs.SE])
abstract: Context: Recent research has used data mining to develop techniques that can guide developers through source code changes. To the best of our knowledge, very few studies have investigated data mining techniques and--or compared their results with other algorithms or a baseline. Objectives: This paper proposes an automatic method for recommending source code changes using four data mining algorithms. We not only use these algorithms to recommend source code changes, but we also conduct an empirical evaluation. Methods: Our investigation includes seven open-source projects from which we extracted source change history at the file level. We used four widely data mining algorithms \ie{} Apriori, FP-Growth, Eclat, and Relim to compare the algorithms in terms of performance (Precision, Recall and F-measure) and execution time. Results: Our findings provide empirical evidence that while some Frequent Pattern Mining algorithms, such as Apriori may outperform other algorithms in some cases, the

Abstract: Context: Recent research has used data mining to develop techniques that can guide developers through source code changes. To the best of our knowledge, very few studies have investigated data mining techniques and--or compared their results with other algorithms or a baseline. tldr: 本研究提出了一种自动推荐源代码变更的方法，使用了四种数据挖掘算法，并在实证研究中比较了它们的性能和执行时间。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes an automatic method for recommending source code changes using four data mining algorithms, and compares their performance and execution time through empirical evaluation on multiple open-source projects.
